meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh sound like a cat
meanings.sent1: The stray cat would wrawl loudly outside my window at night.
meanings.sent2: The kitten started to wrawl when it got scared.
meanings.sent3: I couldn't sleep because the cat decided to wrawl a midnight concert.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm made the wind wrawl through the trees like a choir of felines.
meanings.sent5: The wrawling of the cats in the alley was a cacophony of discordant notes.

meanings.definition: A loud, harsh sound like a cat
meanings.sent1: The wrawl of the cat startled me in the dark alley.
meanings.sent2: The eerie wrawl echoed through the empty house.
meanings.sent3: The wrawl of the cat sounded like a spooky Halloween soundtrack.
meanings.sent4: The wrawl of the cat pierced the silence of the night like a sharp blade.
meanings.sent5: The wrawl of the cat sent shivers down my spine as I walked past.

meanings.sent1: The siblings would wrawl over who got to use the toy first.
meanings.sent2: The neighbors could hear the couple wrawl about their noisy parties.
meanings.sent3: The monkeys in the zoo seemed to wrawl over the last banana.
meanings.sent4: The politicians continued to wrawl over the budget without reaching a compromise.
meanings.sent5: The wrawling of the seagulls over the fish scraps was a chaotic symphony.
